risks.explanation: The dispute resolution clause specifies binding arbitration in San Francisco, CA. This may be an inconvenient and expensive location for the Consultant if they are not located nearby.

The Client has only 5 business days to review deliverables, after which they are deemed accepted. This may be insufficient time for thorough review and feedback, potentially leading to disputes later on.

The Consultant warrants that the Work Product will be free from material defects for 90 days after delivery. This places responsibility on the consultant for a period after the work is delivered, and any defects found during that time will be their responsibility. While reasonable, it's a potential liability.

counters.counter: The Consultant's liability being limited to the total fees paid in the 12 months preceding a claim is a common practice in contracts. This approach directly links the liability to the economic value of the relationship. It's a risk management tool that provides clarity on potential compensation.
counters.industry_context: Caps based on fees paid are frequently used in SaaS and service agreements. While specific figures vary, capping liability at 1x or 2x the annual fees is standard.
